IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Providing secondary and post-graduate education and undertaking research activities.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION IS THREEFOLD: 1) TO PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL QUALITY OF EDUCATION TO OUR UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS, 2) TO UNDERTAKE LEADING RESEARCH AND SCHOLARSHIP ENDEAVORS, 3) TO SERVICE OUR COMMUNITY, NATION AND COMMUNITY OF NATIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Ancillary Services (includes housing, residences, meals and other services provided to and for students and the community).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University maintains a collection of fine art that includes European art, historical and modern Canadian art, contemporary American and Canadian art, Inuit art, and African sculpture as well as a collection of rare and historical books. Contributions of collection items are recorded at nominal value and are not amortized. Collection purchases are expensed as acquired.

The University's collection is extensive in pieces of works of art. The University offers multiple degree programs which include degrees in Art History, Classics, Fine Art and History. Having such collections contributes to program delivery.
Endowment funds are held to aid the University in fulfillment of its mission.
Queen's University embodies inclusiveness in all aspects of its offerings. Equity is of prime importance and value to the University. Queen's website includes information on a "Global Campus".
Universities in the Province of Ontario receive funding from the Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities. In addition, various government agencies provide funding for research projects.

Grants outside of the US consists of Student assistance paid to students. The office of the registrar administers and monitors all awards. See www.queensu.ca/studentawards/financialassistance for more details.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - GRANTS INSIDE THE US CONSIST OF STUDENT ASSISTANCE PAID TO US STUDENTS. THE OFFICE OF THE REGISTRAR ADMINISTERS AND MONITORS ALL AWARDS. SEE WWW.QUEENSU.CA/STUDENTAWARDS/FINANCIALASSISTANCE FOR MORE DETAILS.

The University has a travel policy that outlines allowable expenses. Please refer to the Financial Services Policy section on our website at www.queensu.ca/financialservices/policies-procedures. This policy is in accordance with applicable federal and provincial legislation including but not limited to legislation issued by the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) and the Broader Public Sector (BPS) Accountability Act, 2010 and all related directives.

The Board of Trustees has multiple committees of which one is the Human Resources committee. This committee annually reviews and evaluates comments of the board and key stakeholders regarding the performance of the Principal and also reviews the overall compensation of the Principal. The committee also monitors executive and senior institutional management salaries and provides direction to management for labour negotiations and collective bargaining for all University Employees. The university is supported by the provincial government and is subject to Ontario Legislation related to compensation and this is taken into account and applied as necessary. More details can be found at www.queensu.ca/secretariat/board-trustees/committees/human-resources-commi ttee.

The University utilizes services of CIBC Wood Gundy (Division of CIBC - Canadian Imperial Bank Of Commerce) to accept and liquidate gifts of shares/stocks. Shares are received to our investment account, liquidated immediately, and net cash proceeds are forwarded to Queen's.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees election process is segregated by categories. Board of Trustees, University Council, Staff, Students, and Faculty/libarians/Archivists are able to elect a certain number of members. Please refer to www.queensu.ca/secretariat/elections/board-trustees/categories-and-eligibi lity for more details.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Working papers are prepared using supporting papers for the financial statements of the University and submitted to KPMG as support to fill in the tax return. The completed return is reviewed and approved by the Director - Financial Reporting & Systems and the Controller of Queen's University at Kingston and then reviewed and signed by the Associate Vice-Principal (Finance and Administration). KPMG Files the signed return with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization ensures compliance with the conflict of interest policy by having directors/trustees read and sign a copy of the policy and clarifying or indentifying any conflict of interest that they may have. This policy is requested to be signed on a yearly basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees has multiple committees of which one is the Human Resources committee. This commitee annually reviews and evaluates comments of the board and key stakeholders regarding the performance of the Principal and reviews the overall compensation of the principal. The committee also monitors executive and senior institutional management salaries and provides direction to management for labour negotiations and collective bargaining for all university employees. The university is supported by the provincial government and is subject to Ontario Legislation related to compensation and this is taken into account and applied as necessary.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University's Governance policies are available on the secretariat's website at www.queenu.ca/secretariat/policies. Human Resources policies are available online on the HR website at www.queensu.ca/humanresources/policies. Financial statements are available online at www.queensu.ca/financialservices/publications.

Difference amounts to two major items: 1) Foreign Exchange differences resulting from changes in the CAD to USD rates between balance sheet dates; 2) Different treatment and presentation of items under Canadian GAAP.
